Naruto is a masterpiece buttttttttt jjba part seven steel ball run is ranked second so TAKE THAT NARUTO STANS.But if im being for real naruto is a masterpiece and in my opinion its a starting anime there are so many genres but naruto is just a average shounen jump normal power system and very well boring at times.Out of 500 episodes 210 are fillers thats 40 episodes away from being half FORTY.Almost half of naruto is just fillers and straight up boring.Comparing it to jjba is in my opinion pretty rude so I wont.Now that we got past the bad part the good parts well its probably just the memorys and friends i made.Naruto was the first anime I have ever watched (other than pokemon) so it will always hold a place in my heart.

This may be a hot take but I do not find Naruto to be a very well written character. He has no character growth throughout the show and you always know what he will do. It makes the show agonizingly predictable. Also many main cast characters such as Sakura are also very poorly written. Its also a shame because Naruto has some of the most well written characters in all of anime, but they are surprisingly under covered in the story. Secondly the show does a great job making a very interesting story between Sasuke and Naruto (although I think its a bit under-covered). Also the story behind Itachi is truly a written masterpiece. Overall the main thing the story has going for it is that the writers did a great job of making lovable characters. You are hooked to the anime to see if the characters will succeed. And in the end they do. But now... yall know I was going to talk about this... Fillers... Okay so... If I take away the fillers I would rate naruto probably a 8 or 9. But the sheer antagonizing fillers brings this show all the way to a 5. If you calculate. 47% of this entire show is filler. Let that sink it. Even if you have a filler guide, near the end the fillers all have some vital info so you need to watch SMH.

Naruto Shippuden one of the most captivating animes I have seen. Out of the few animes I have completed I'm glad I made it to the finale of Naruto but let's get to the review now. Story- Naruto Shippuden has a really detailed story at times the pacing isn't the greatest but overall I think they did a good job. Many people will say there's to much "filler" but to me there are many cool stories told in them and even sometimes things that could have been apart of the manga like when the akatsuki caught the 3 and 6 tails. Speaking of the akatsuki what an amazingly well written villain group and there motivations are well explained especially later when introduced to Madara. Madara might be the best written villain in anime I say might because I haven't finished many anime yet. This story is fantastic and many more that are considering Naruto Shippuden I would definitely recommend it. 10/10 Character Development- There's alot of development for characters from Naruto to Filler Characters. Naruto goes from an outcast and hated by the village to proving himself and earning the respect and love of all the leaf (even though he could have turned on them). Kakashi goes from someone struggling with depression and at fault not seeing any happiness to being able to forgive himself and be a leader for young ninjas in Konoha. Itachi goes from being someone that was precieved as a murderer and awful human to being someone who ultimately did anything he could for his brother and village. The only characters that didn't see any development were Sakura and Sasuke in my opinion. 8/10 Animation- The animation was pretty solid throughout and really shines at the most crucial moments. 8/10 Overall- Naruto Shippuden is an amazing anime with consistently good animations and an amazing story that gives most of its characters great spotlight to become more fleshed out and complete the only thing that should have happened and didn't was Naruto becoming the Hokage at the end but it makes since as he was still a genin (even though he's Kage Level). 9/10

One of the best animes there is Naruto is recognized as one of the faces of anime and one of the big 4 for a reason. ill give a short review on the story, characters, and fighting below. i'll do this without spoiling :D Story: the story of Naruto is very well thought out. It has a red line and the villains and their objectives stay the same while simultaneously evolving as we progress with the story. Naruto and the other characters have a lot of growth and as they grow their opponents are scaled with them. meaning in the beginning when Naruto is still not that strong he does not really face the end boss level characters. it feels very organic how the power scaling is increased, its not like "he defeated the boss here is another boss who is 10x stronger" but instead he fights weaker opponents while growing, or he has help by strong allies. as the story progresses they get stronger and can handle stronger foes. There is also some drama aspects touching on topics like forgiveness, revenge, love and other stuff. this makes the series even better. when they touch on the characters lives it makes the series more personal to the viewer and not just some slop you watch and forget. There is however one flaw that the series has and its the fillers. since the story was not complete the animators had to create filler episodes which can get a bit tedious. I watched them all haha but truth be told sometimes i wished they didnt use them since back when i watched it i saw the new episodes weekly. 41% of the show is fillers. theres a LOT you learn about the characters that is not included in the source but that they added, some of it is worth it some not. if you don't have patience since the story is already very long, look up guides on which episodes are complete fillers and which ones are half filelr half story and try to watch only the story and the story-filler episodes. Its definitely worth it Characters: all characters are so well thought out, everyone has a unique personality and all the important characters have so much growth. if you watch the original Naruto and Shippuden then you feel like you grow up with these characters and you really root for your favourites, and you feel sad when some of them die. The show does a wonderful job expanding on the already existing characters while also introduing new ones all the time. sometimes they swap the main characters squad members, but its always under very non-forced conditions that atually are needed to progress the story. like if a character is hurt and is healing then that character is replaced with a substitute for some time. or since this is Shippuden, as everyone knows, Sasuke is no longer part of team 7, so they get a third member. Not that there is a lot of team 7 activities lol Fighting: the fighting is another aspect that makes the series shine just like the story and the characters do. the fighting scenes are really good, there is a giant variation of different attacks and every characters (expect background ones) have their unique fighting styles. it never gets boring. everytime a new character is introduced you get excited to find out how that person fights. even though the series has a lot of big moves and super strong attacks it still feels a little realistic in the sense that a cut wound will cut and that characters can die. its not like they will take giant attacks to the face, bounce a 100 times, hit some wall and just get up (unless they have some protective layer or something lol). Its important that the characters actually dodge the attacks, which is why substitution jutsus and dodging skills are something most characters also have. a lot of characters use different ways to avoid attacks as well which gives the combat another layer of exitement. its not only unique offensive skills but unique defensive skills as well. so the viewer is left thinking "how will he survive" as well as "how will he defeat his opponent" most times someone fights. except the people with plot armor the series is not so forgiving to attacks. some very strong character could lose his arm in a random fight agains another character, and then have to fight the rest of the series with only one arm for example. although most of these injuries and deaths do not happen to the collective "main characters" which basically are the people from the same generation as the main character. they survive most fights and its other filler characters who are introduced later on that get all misforture overall: 10/10 across. the only downside is that the show consists of 41% filler episodes

Naruto shippuuden could have been a really good anime, but, after a while in the anime they start using flashbacks, and not a few. Sometimes these flashbacks takes up 90% of a epsiode and the episode after shows even more flashbacks. Most of the flashbacks are not needed therefore they ruin the show. The story it self is really good and is something that you can come a long way with, and they do they continue to put out new arcs that fits with the story. It could have been great. It could have been a really good anime. But with all of these flashbacks it aint.

Fillers is all I have to say. Reason for my score is fillers(38% so far). if you want a list of fillers http://www.narutohq.com/naruto-shippuden-fillers.php. So you can skip them if you start it. i'm keeping the review short. The story has nothing special, just a knucklehead hero that saves the day and thats about it. character development is pretty neat in this show, you can see some of the characters grow. Which is kinda cool. You can get a connection to some of the characters and that is what I Think makes this show. Mostly this anime seems to be about fan service.

I have been sa watcher of Naruto for over three years now, and I must say, it has changed A LOT! Allow me to explain. Story: The Story overall is kind of good. I like the whole original idea of Ninjas being the supreme beings in the world and like to kick each others asses just to show off their powerful swirling balls of air. In fact, sometimes it was SO original, that I couldn't even keep up with the huge cluster fuck of plot twists and new characters that were popping up in between canon and filler arcs. Since I made I to that part, let's talk abouit the fillers. YAAAAAYYY! We all luv um. I lied, I hate them actually. And Naruto's fillers are SOO BAD that I, at one point, dropped the anime for a year, came back a year later, and they have only advanced 20 episodes of Canon. The gap between canon and filler is so small now. There is new BORING filler arc every month. It is PATHETIC!!! Art: The art for the anime was pretty good at the beginning of the series. The character design was complex and different, but as the series progressed, the art became lazier and lazier. Did you see the art for the Pein Arc? Holy Shit, what a fucking mess. And its only been worse from there. I'm scared that its going to turn into fucking Lucky Star five years from now. And we all know its going to last that long too, so shut up. Sound: All of the openings are also lazily done including the transitional music. They all sound the fucking same! The first Naruto series before Shippuden was pretty gifted in its music. Sadness and Sorrow was a really good song. One of my favorites, but it all went downhill from there. Character: There are s many characters, and surprisingly, I've managed to memorize all of their names. It's pretty amazing, . But seriously, thatsd the problem. Theres just too many. And the ones that are superfluous are just a waste of animation! They are fricking annoying and can't fight for themselves! All of his friends are pretty stupid. Enjoyment: Meh Overall: 6.5

I liked naruto a lot, i used to be hyped when the new episode would come, and then again we get another moodkill by another filler, its simply just to much fillers, i'm not planning on watching it untill it is done, cause i don't wanna have 1 episode and 20 fillers every time i'm waiting for a new episode. Even if they say the fillers are ended, i don't have the trust in watching anymore, simply had to many downers on naruto. i don't wanna enjoy 5 episode's and then another bunch of shitty fillers. I maybe would have enjoyed the fillers more if the where before the war, or just in some more OVA's those happen during the war, My naruto rate dropped from 9 to 6.

I will always have a soft spot for Naruto Shippuden. I practically grew up watching it and let me tell you, it was not just a cartoon for me, it was an a history with many lessons, the formation of those lessons and life as well and then, some very good tips on becoming brave, striving on and most importantly, friendship. Beginning or rather ending with the first episode towards the last one, Naruto Shippuden is absolutely amazing and there is no better way to express this rather highly by fiddling the emotional strings of the die-hard fan. The centre of this Changing formula is in character development, notably in the case of the protagonist, Naruto Uzumaki. Naruto’s many stages of growth and development would also contain such changes the most important one being the transition from undesirable to stubborn and prominent teen-hero intending to be the Hokage once within his lifetime which was quite well motivating. Easier said than done. It is not merely a physical endurance but also a active resolution to stop difficulties and a battle waged within oneself that in the end makes a person out of the weak boy. Moreover, he seeks for reasons to walk the path he has never stepped before, awakes at the sit of turmoil and the heat of the matter sort of thing, and anger towards the external enemy gets repressed— a fact for which there is no room in the epic, and all these qualities do not let the reader forget the character of that boy. Furthermore, the show explores these characters and their bonds further like every other shounen anime or manga does, each with their own story. These three and the rest known are not just flat figures, they are also very talented and intelligent individuals who had great deal of learning and want to have certain values. My enemies in good movies and reading really battles and flip these enemy attitides. The growth of Naruto’s relationship with each of these people, in particular his bond with Sasuke along with the rivalry, is one where one can not take his eyes off the screen. Adding to the fact that Naruto Shippuden tops all other in terms of high production-value action scenes and strong fighting performances, it also has exceptionally high quality pre-written dialogue for the performances. The details of the fights are beautifully evocative, yet most notably these action scenes are very effective in their delivery of tension. It’s not just the content of each dangerous bout that feels substantial – either against fearsome opponents or battlefields filled with military conflict – but the stakes as well, because every fight is significant and not only for the purpose of showing different abilities. Yasuharu Takanashi, the composer for the show, also did all of the soundtracks, most of which were loud when played and made Naruto Shippuden a highly emotional show. Every emotional instant is enhanced with the skillfully composed songs including the famous theme songs and the mystifying background music, established an extremely strong bond with the viewer making the playback of the show enjoyable fully. I can say with confidence, that for me. Naruto Shippuden wasn’t only an anime that I loved - it is a series that many I northern crumpled, watching it along growing up and hence this fact holds several alright memories. It has episodes that evoked my emotions, others made me laugh, and somewhere in between them I had to review my life’s ideals like how much loyalty is important, how some kind of stiff adherence to faith and resolve is wrong and how it’s wrong to abandon all one’s dreams… Such a show is motivational and it will remain a fond memory and a part of me. I would most certainly rate Naruto Shippuden as a 10/10. It is not just a piece of work but a piece of art because for people, me as well, that have a certain age this is a part of them, the part that they grew up with.

The story is absolutely beautiful. You have epic fights combined with deep emotions and unpredictable story changes that will blow your mind. Marvelous. There are dozens of different characters and every one is unique. Let's take the villain Orochimaru for example. He is easily the most well-designed antagonist I have seen in any motion picture, even in all the books I read I can't find a character like him. In my opinion, Shippūden surpasses the original Naruto in some ways. Both are amazing shows, so what you favor more is up to you. Whether you decide on that or not, it is undeniable that Naruto Shippuden is a very successful and strong follow up to Naruto. It further explores the depth of many characters old and new. My favorite thing about this show is how each antagonist hardly feels like a villain. I was touched by their philosophies and how each compared to Naruto, the classic “bring peace to the world” guy. My only complaints with the show were the dragging out of the Great Ninja War. This show, for me, was a 10/10 until the War. It was a good arc, BUT I found myself struggling to get through it towards the end. All in all, Naruto Shippuden was a fun watch!

I have watched Naruto/Naruto Shippuuden as a child and loved the action, now that I am older an have been watching anime for many many years (17) out of the hundreds of shonen anime, Naruto takes the first place prize! you can watch Naruto simply for the action, but you can dig much much deeper into the characters past and see their development, as well as see the wonderful meaning behind the story, the depth of some characters truly amazes me, and the mystery is not lacking either! You truly feel like your there experiencing these characters emotions as well as the story first hand! This is a great first anime especially! I cannot tell you how many people have gone from hating anime to loving it because I recommended Naruto series to them. I consider my self a seasoned veteran when it comes to shonen anime, and I am pretty picky about what I consider 10/10, but Naruto hits the ball out of the park!! Even the 3rd time I watched the series all the way through, there was STILL things that I did not even think about and mystery to uncover. IF you have not watched Naruto I suggest you do, stick with it and really look at the whole show (depth, story, characters, plot, theme) or just stick around for the fights, up to you either way you will not be disappointed! The last thing I will leave you with is, if you really do not like filler, skip the Naruto fillers and go back and watch them at a later time. A lot of them are really funny, JUST MAKE SURE THEY ARE ACTUALLY FILLER! some episodes are cannon/filler mix!

The sequel to Naruto's first part is bigger, better, and most definitely worth your time. This is an anime every anime fan should see, a timeless masterpiece. There's a reason Naruto is part of The Big 3 Shounens. Like all anime and manga it has its shortcomings, so I'll talk about what's good and what's not. Overall however, this is beyond phenomenal. First off, if you want the best experience watching Naruto: skip all the fillers. And I mean all of them. I'll talk about that later. I don't even know where to start with why I love this masterpiece. As if the 'original' Naruto series wasn't already fantastic Shippuden cranks things up to 100; mostly for the better. The 220 episodes of Naruto hyped up the Akatsuki, and they sure as hell delivered Characters: I've never seen more 10/10 characters in one anime. Shippuden introduces almost double the amount of important characters and they all are beyond amazing. It just gets better as you watch. Fights: 10/10. Easy. Mob Psycho, Chainsaw Man, and Jojo tier-fights. Apart from some of them being a bit drawn out these are some of the most logical, entertaining, consistent, and emotional fights. Plot & Filler: The canon plot is slightly drawn out, especially the last arc of Shippuden, but it nonetheless is a 10/10. The characters, fights, plot twists, and everything in between are so addictive and fun to watch. Now filler. 'Older' animes used to add a bunch of filler, god knows why, and naruto is certainly one of them. Over 200 episode in Shippuden are filler. Two. Hundred. And they are horrible, just like part 1 of Naruto. Don't do what I did and sit through every one of them, it's not worth it. Skip all of it, genuinely only 8 or so episodes out of the 300 naruto filler episodes spanning this and part one are worth it: The Kakashi Mask episode (part 1) and Kakashi's Anbu arc. Overall: 9.8/10 There's a reason Naruto is and will forever be one of the most popular and highly loved anime of all time. A must watch for anyone who finished part 1, and if you haven't seen part 1 you should. It's incredible. This is an explosion of art, simple as that.

One of my favorite anime. Most of the characters are so brilliant. The plot is top-notch, and except for the whining of some characters, the many filler episodes, and the unnecessary flashbacks, this anime is one of my top 3. I can highly recommend this anime to everyone. You won't regret it, and you won't find anything else in a similar genre that's as good. Einer meiner Lieblings Anime. Die meisten Charaktere sind so genial. Die Handlung top und bis auf das rumgeheule einiger Charaktere, die vielen Filler Folgen und die unnötigen Rückblicke ist dieser Anime einer meiner Top 3 ich kann diesen Anime nur jedem wärmstens ans Herz legen. Ihr werdet es nicht bereuen und auch keinen finden, der im ähnlichen Bereich so gut ist

Here we have a world that holds quite an immersive story which not only advances over time, but even events of the world's past end up building up the events that took place in the story's present era. As for the characters (ignoring filler characters) we saw a lot of them grow up over time (especially due to the use of the time skip) as well as see just how corrupting a tale of revenge can be. Though of course we'll always have our complaints on some things ('Useless' Sakura and Sasuke only paying an arm for his actions), but they don't really do much damage to the series overall. So great series overall...but the only real downside in my opinion would be the sheer amount of fillers in this and its predecessor (Naruto). Such is the fate of the 2000s era mainstream anime.

Many of you will maybe be surprised of why i gave Naruto: Shippuden a 10/10, and trust me, i don't understand 100% either... To be completely honest, I would never say this was the best anime of all time, my rating is more personally. Anyways.. Story: The story in Naruto is good, and just amazing, no doubt about that. The story never really got boring for me, it kept becoming even better. I would say that it is one of the best stories in anime, and I really recommend watching it if you love good stories. Animation: The animation overall isn't bad at all, but when it came to fight scenes it went a little off at times, and the reason for it was simply just for their choice of style in some fights (Which happens a lot in anime, not just Naruto). But most of the fights are amazingly animated, and I'll watch them again. Fillers: I know damn well that Naruto has many goddamn fillers, and many of them are below average.. But I really don't want to rate an anime for their fillers, and I don't understand why people trash talk it this much. If you don't like it, then most of them are 100% skippable. Personally I choose to just watch them. And no, I did not enjoy them, but a couple of them were fairly okay. Music and sound: The music in the original Naruto is good, but had some that were under decent. In Naruto: Shippuuden all opening are and just the music in the episodes are great. I really liked and enjoyed it all. Character: The characters in Naruto is outstanding, i would say it's at least in top 10 animes with the best characters, maybe top 5. All tho the villains and main characters are made greatly, there were some characters that they missed too much potential in, and that really annoys me. The character development is great, but it could have been much better. They really went carefully when choosing people to die, but to be honest, they didn't choose enough. And it could have made it even better. There were too many characters, and so you would have expected a lot of them to die, but apparently not. Ending: I can't really say the ending was perfect, but i wouldn't say it wasn't good either. It became a little rushed at the end, but i think it worked out okay. Sub or Dub?: I watched it in Sub, and i also think Sub is the better choice. I didn't watch dub, but i watched a little of it, and i liked it. They were both made finely. Overall: I gave it a 10/10, which is very overrated, i know i know. But personally, i can't stop giving it 10. The Anime just hit me differently. But if i had to give it a rating outside that, I'll give it a 8/10. Maybe 7,5/10. Also, the anime was also really carried by the story. The best elements of the show are the music/sound, characters, story, and personally the plot too, even tho the plot can be basic at times.

Oh, Naruto. An anime that you never thought would never end. I've seen shonen anime like this where it's essentially a story about someone wanting to be something in their future, as well as something more compared to others who have tried. Part 1 dealt with the whole idea of strategy vs talent. It made you feel inspired to go out into the world and essentially be who you want to be and not be limited by anything out there. The concept of it's possible no matter what anyone else says. Shippuden aka Part 2 is different and in that, it's focus was more on the world of Naruto rather than the actual character. Sure, Naruto Shippuden has interesting characters but the focus was obviously more on how they were (their backstories) rather than their present life. Sure, events transpire and they're still awesome to look at.. but when you look at it, it's like Naruto Shippuden became more interested in adding characters rather than actually developing them. Sure, they did but it felt very slow. It's not something bad just something. Quantity over Quality even though Shippuden does have its moments. In fact, this whole idea of Shippuden being very different and somewhat lost what made it special reminds me of the shift from the first 3 Fast and Furious movies all the way to the "now" which are completely action with less racing. The only outward thing I can say about Naruto Shippuden is that it's a lesson on how a writer can have problems when something they've created has become so huge that it's completely messy. Don't get me wrong, I like the characters as well as the overall story. But the way it was told was a little slow. Not only that, but this particular show is littered and cursed by filler. It's technically a meme that Naruto Shippuden is known mostly by its messy filler in between the stories that make it good and to be honest, that's what sad about it. Naruto has always been a story where you can pretty much feel emotion running through you especially since the writer/author is good at conveying emotion through his fights. However, because of Shonen Jump's harsh schedule, it ruined his draftsmanship and overall, ruined the anime. Nevertheless, Shippuden is undoubtedly a phenomenon. With iconic villains and characters as well as notable abilities and moments with amazing conclusions in its stories. This had a great finale to something so huge that it can be comparable to Harry Potter's Deathly Hallows and the MCU's Endgame. Every segment in Naruto is an event; An idea that Boruto or any anime might never, or might not be able to replicate ever again. It's an anime that meant to a lot of people and it will never be forgotten. However, like life itself; it had to end. And while it ends, you can feel the emotion through each final episode. And it shows that the writer, while he had his flaws, is truly a talented and amazing writer. Thank you, Masashi Kishimoto.

Naruto is a series that a lot of people enjoy, my self-included at one point. That opinion changed however upon a second view of the series as a whole. While the many flaws that exist within this show could be repeated, they are ultimately mute as the real problems that exist in this show are most prevalent in it's story/character direction and its predictability. Naruto is a story that set itself up from the very beginning as a tale about a nobody coming from nothing and struggling to become the greatest so as to earn the respect and acknowledgement of his peers and those in his community. It is a decent plot, one that has been unfortunately been beaten like a dead horse throughout shonen for the past several decades. As many know upon the completion of Shippuden however, that idea went out the window. Naruto is revealed to have been the reincarnation of the Christ analog of his universe as he and the rest of the main cast of heroes and villains are ushered into the levels of godhood that no other ninja regardless of effort could hope to replicate. Many state that this is where Naruto lost sight of its identity but I argue something more introspective. It never had one. Naruto has always had the Nine-Tails inside of him since episode one, a mass of chakra with whom there are no contenders. Naruto uses the Nine-Tails to overcome every fight in the series in some way, shape, or form with one (arguably two) exceptions. Unfortunately, that isn't rising from nothing. That's taking the worlds greatest advantage and using it like a crutch instead of bettering yourself but then passing it off as of own efforts born of sweat, blood, and tears. If you took the Nine-Tails away from Naruto or created a situation where he couldn't bulldoze his way through a fight with virtually unlimited power, I can guarantee you that Naruto would lose and his opponent would be uninjured. All of his efforts only amount to him getting beat up on screen for ten minutes until he decides to end his fights with his signature technique, the Nine-Tails, or a combination of the two. You could watch all the fights that transpired with Naruto and 99.8 of them end this way. It gets to the point where fans of the series already know in the back of their mind how a fight is going to end before it even starts. Beyond that, the cast suffers from Bleach syndrome, in that the series has way too many side characters and jutsu and doesn't develop a majority of them beyond the surface level. The main cast is okay. I don't dislike Sakura and though she can be infuriating at times, I regard her as just another shonen woman who is doing her best to contribute to a series that primarily doesn't need her. I found Sasuke interesting, even for rival archetypes as his role is primarily undefined by Naruto which is good. Barring some moments where he acted out of character through the later half of the series, I was at least invested in his story. Kakashi is a great character with whom I probably never would have gotten through Naruto if he was not there. His role as the group mentor however was not the best as he is quickly abandoned by all three main characters midway through the series and is then out right replaced during a particular arc only to note upon his return that his students have surpassed him and don't need him anymore when they arguably have never needed him. The series also falls victim to key events that are ultimately made contrived to the point of insanity for the sake of preserving continuity and plot holes so gaping, I'm surprised they haven't imploded the series into several, conjoining black holes. I don't hate Naruto, as it is a series that does it's job in entertaining viewers (to an extent) but I can't help but feel as though it failed to tell the story it wanted to tell. Even part of the end goal is not even addressed until another (less popular) spin-off which cheapens the adventure that viewers invested their time in to see. While I would not recommend this series to anyone curious, I will not deter them from doing so as Naruto is an undeniably an experience but one that may leave you feeling disappointed and cheated.

King of retcons. Queen of killing continuity. I thought this was some hype shit; at least for a shonen. But my dumbass was like 10 at the time and looking back it was mediocre at best and I don’t understand how people older than me can see it as otherwise. When the series first started, the show was about strategy and mastery of stealth, jutsu, and planning. Now what? Who can explode more shit? Who has the biggest ghost monster. A betrayal of nostalgia. If you want to watch/read a shonen, go read One Piece (don’t watch pacing is shit). 2/10.

It is one of the big 3. Everyone really enjoys it.Although it has many fillers but some fillers are worth watching like kakashi story,Indra and Ashura arc,Past arc etc.Overall it was amazing for me.I do not know why people dislike it.I know it has filler episodes but one can skip some episodes.It has a nice story. Naruto became hero from 0.And the rivalry between sasuke and naruto was the best rivalry I have ever seen.At first the pace was slow.But it becomes good after some arc probably 3.And the war was the best. Naruto is the typical story where friendship will allege everything, now put that with 200 filler chapters and a plot that constantly contradicts itself, the best it has without a doubt is its soundtrack and in some moments its animation, Naruto has many failures and he is late many times, making late plots, like Sasuke's, when it no longer matters, Naruto is recommended, but only if you don't see the filler, because counting the filler naruto is a bad anime, that only its popuradity It saves from being forgotten, even if it has good characters such as Shikamaru or Jiraya, in some moments it transmits emotions such as sadness or emotion, but they are rarely because there is almost always a failure in the plot that aurrinates it.

Naruto shippuuden is one of the best anime series ever made. This is the first time i am reviewing an anime series ,i have watched more than 70 anime series yet but my first review had to be naruto because i grew watching this ,i have learned so much about real life from it ,my ideal my way of thinking has been influenced by naruto.I can't tell how much i have cried watching this show ,there are just so much emotions in this show ,that u can feel every character .I can't remember how much i cried watching naruto ,the music is just too good it will make you crying and still now when i watch naruto (after 6 years of finishing it) it still make my eyes wet.This show gives great message which are applicable in real life. Lets start the review by talking about the story ,Naruto shippuden has one of the best story written ever , a normal human can never think of such a great story ,the story of naruto shippuuden is its root ,the base of the show .Its a very emotional and motivating story. The story will not disappoint you .The story is so well connected with past and present the characters are so well jumbled up with the plot ,every characters have significant role .Every character is given so well background and there are so many great characters thats y people have liked so many characters other then main characters .i definitely recommend watching this show because the story is just so good with every element like emotions ,hatred ,rage , sacrifice ,love and much more that this story is just so much worth watching.This fact is to be noted that the base of the story are taken from real world legends ,like the concept of chakra ,the kaguya princess ,indra-ashura , which i think is really a great work. The animation studio did a brilliant job in this show ,this much good that some of the current show are not able to .Let me say naruto series have one the best fight scene ever made ,and the intelligence and chorography is amazing in the fight is just too great. Another best thing of naruto is the music ,i will not say that it has one of the best music work because it has the best music work i believe ,the music is just too awesome believe me ,the opening and ending are soo soo good that they will stay alive even after the show has ended not every op and end is great but most of them are amazing. The emotional theme ,from moment to moment really hype me up , seriously the work on music wheather it op and ed or the theme everything is just too too good ,no matter what words i pick i can never appreciate them enough. Naruto is definitely every emotional show ,but that's not all about it there is great comedy in it which makes us laugh out loud , memorable battle scene are there ,so many great quotes of different character that we can realize in our life ,its not just a show when u watch it ,u live it ,deeper and deeper u can fell in this show ,u can feel the emotions and they are so realistic ,which makes u cry like hell ,i think when we cry watching a show then it means the author was able to convey u what he wanted .its not just a show for me ,its a feeling ,a feeling that i love very much ,i really wish that all the memories of this show gets deleted so that i can watch it again ,feel the way i used to ,cry the way i used to ,be excited about those suspense. Lets talk about the drawback of the show ,even when it's one of the most amazing show ever made ,still it has too many drawbacks , everyone knows about it that it has too many fillers ,which is one the biggest problem also the reason of low rating ,just too many fillers. If they could remove the fillers and releasing separately then i am sure naruto could have been in top 10 list. I can keep on writing about this anime , because it made me feel that deeply but i will end it here. Thank you so so much for giving us such awesome show , really appreciate the author of the show ,the whole studio ,all the music work ,all the hard work is really appreciated thank you so much for giving us naruto.

God I hated this whole series.... *spoilers ahead* 1.Bad Character development of girls especially. 2. No reason to hate Naruto bcoz he is a jinchuriki. Yes, he being hated for being mischievous is fine. But throwing stones at him and all was just too much. I would question the mindset of Leaf village of the people once lead by Hashirama. 3. No concrete reasons for Madara for doing what he does. Why does he want to make world better by putting everyone in The Matrix? (except Pain and Orochimaru their reasons were best). 4. Plot holes and unexplained power ups at the end. 5. Fillers....sooo many horrible filers And here my major reasons- When you have created such a huge world it is important to explore that (especially 5 great nations). There was no proper exploring of the entire shinobi world, the various customs, history, etc. Most important- why create the whole concept of Jinchuriki and Tailed beasts and show only two of them properly (Bee and Naruto, I am not even counting Gara). I wanted to know all Jinchuriki names, powers and back stories and most importantly see their all out fights with akatsuki and others. Also don’t each of the tailed beats have some special power that even their jinchuriki can use? (other thab TB bombs and chakra cloak). Most important#2 Do all cool and badass clans live in Konoha? I wished to see other village clans and their keke genkais. But as i said there was no exploring. Deidara and kisame were only good other village ninjas for me. Why make the 7 swordsmen of mist if not going to show each properly. Only Zabuza and Kisame are shown all cool. All of them should've been cool and shown in all out fight against protagonists and other characters and be in the story. Also, other than Kisame’s and Zabuza’s swords others were not that cool. Samehada was way too cool. All 7 should be equal badass swords. Other villages top fighting forces should’ve been shown. Just like 7 Shinobi swordsmen. Rock Lee was done bad, he had potential to be awesome! Might Guy should’ve died. His death would’ve been very impactful. Seems his life is just a pitiful drag on now on a wheel chair. Orochimaru should’ve remained evil. Who doesn’t want an ultimate evil genius? He should’ve been one of the ultimate villains. And also if possible he should have been a major threat in Boruto too. Uchiha clan became too Strong due to Sussano power. I wish it was a Rinnegan specific power. Reanimation in the end was not following rules. Madara could do just whatever he wants. It seemed a bit like plot device. The Otsutsuki clan should’ve been hyped from the start (of Naruto series) and a proper back story for origins of chakra and Ninjutsu should’ve been given- step by step. So when Kaguya finally makes her appearance it would look cool. In all Naruto had all the potential to be the best anime ever. Awesome fight scenes and great animation but if you had the huge budget you should of hired better writers

Shippuden is literal fillers to the characters past. But incase you're skipping all the fillers,it's an enjoyable series. Plenty of likeable characters even though Naruto is still cringy to watch :/. I remember so many of the OP's in Naruto because it's just that good. The character development is tolerable,I suppose. The story feels rather slow at times,but it's alright for a shonen anime. In my personal opinion,the Pain arc is the best. Nothing can top that. The action is nice but not that amazing. Naruto:Shippuden is an alright anime at it's core but it can be enjoyable if you're into this kind of stuff. Just don't go expecting great character development or an amazing story cause this anime doesn't have it.

Story: You can break the story of Naruto Shippuden down into one sentence. Naruto's best friends Sasuke Uchiha did fall on the "dark side" and Naruto himself is a great bro so he does everything to bring him back without ever givin up. Sounds pretty boring doesn't it? Well while the story progresses the whole thing gets a lot more complicated. Naruto and his friends would have to face several "bad guys", train a lot to be able to beat them and lose a lot of precious people (very emotional! :( ) and the great thing about it is that everything actually connencts. Talking about the bad guys...they aren't actual bad guys and this is something I liked a lot about Naruto. Usually they are just people who had a really rough live and therefore developed some "bad" but pretty logical philospohy. For example one enemy believed that it is impossible to understand one another except if everyone understands one another's pain. And to understand pain you must experience pain so he became the bad guy to spread pain over the world. During Naruto's fight against that person they had quite an interesting philosophical conversation- something that the series does a lot. The only negative aspect about the sotry is that some of the so called filler episodes (episodes that don't really provide anything to the plot but are pretty important to have a deeper understanding for the character's development aka episodes that you won't find in the Manga) are really bad placed. For example during one of the most intence arcs of the show we got Fillers from OG Naruto- without any logical reason!! My personal opinion is that you should still watch them but you can decide that for yourself (there are filler lists in the internet). 9/10 Art: On one hand some of the greatest most memorable fights in Anime history and some really weird animations due to outsourcing of the animation studio but overall pretty solid. 8/10 Sound: Let's be real on this one. Naruto Shippuden's OST is one of the greatest of all time. Just listen to these: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D-fXTFQlUhY (Sadness and Sorrow) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ikmSfQmtq20 (Orochimaru's theme) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qpi9YXaChHI (Sign) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dlFA0Zq1k2A (Silhouette) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AxNCOajIvEM&list=PL4C928EAF7AA5B906&index=3 (Homecoming) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qbXVmiFr4-8&list=PL4C928EAF7AA5B906&index=7 (Man of the world) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DWY1_Grk3VA (Akatsuki's theme) Characters: Even though there is a ton of characters in this anime you will know every single one after finishing it and that's a fact. Why you might ask? Well simply because all of them are very interesting and most of them have quite a depth due to their past and their actions during the story. The characters will stick to you and if you actually think about them you might learn some valuable lessons about life. Enjoyment: I loved it and felt a vast emptiness after I finished the series and the movies. Overall: For me a 10/10. Simply because I am emotionally very attached to this Anime.
