Oh boy, this is going to be a long one. I put Naruto Shippuden on Hiatus way back when in 2012 or so, when I caught up to the manga. At that time, Bee was first being introduced as a new character. 8 or so years later, I finally, over the stretch of a month, finally finished the entire show. There will be some spoilers in this review. It's been like 7 years since this show has been released, so I highly doubt you haven't watched this show, or plan on doing so anytime soon. In all honesty, Naruto: Shippuuden can be said to contain many flaws, some including ridiculous plot armor, plot holes, and questionable character development. Let's go over them. When talking about the plot in Naruto, one also has to include characters. Characters become a major plot point in many of the most important arcs in Naruto, and so they have to be discussed side by side. And what else but starting with the Main Character himself, Uzumaki Naruto? Naruto can't be considered a terrible shounen main character, and he certainly fills the role quite well. The problem is that much of his character could have been developed in a much greater way than what actually ended up ensuing in his self reflecting and confrontational arcs. His beginning arcs were probably one of the best I've ever seen in a show: gradually transforming from a loner to an identity as a member of team seven. Iruka was the first person to acknowledge Naruto, and this gradual dynamic between Sasuke and Naruto begin to begin. Naruto is able to get acknowledgement and satisfaction from the bonds that he painstakingly forms, and Sasuke doesn't even want to form them in the first place, and thus begins the whole entire setup for their rivalry down the path. However, somewhere along the line, Naruto begins to stagnate as a character. He's extremely immature throughout the entire show, and despite this childish nature, still manages to mature in different ways. This is confusing to say the least. When it comes to his goals, which he eventually finds out with his interactions with Jiraiya and Pain, he's able to easily find his determination and objectives. which of course, can be summed up in: peace. Yet, at the same time, he's idealistic and lacks any sort of concrete plan that allows him to follow up on that objective, and this continues until the very end of the series, where he still has this immature idealistic world view. Neji's death might have been a wake up call for himself, and in some ways, it is. He realizes that in conflict, not everyone can be saved, yet he shouldn't wallow in that despairing emotion, but make sure that the ideals that the person died for wasn't for naught. Perhaps Itachi's talk about how not every burden can be shouldered on his own could also suffice as a rare form of maturing. However, this is where his maturation as a character seems to end, and these moments are few and far between, not to mention, extremely short. There are so many characters and story arcs that focus on Naruto persevering and reinforcing his determination for his goal, but there seems to an extreme lack in any sort of maturing or learning of how he's able to complete such a task. Instead of learning from his own mistakes, he instead gets convenient plot armor in the form of who knows what all scattered throughout the entire series, and this makes him bypass any sort of realization that his actions have consequences. Over and over again, you see Naruto charging into battle, determined to follow through his ideals, and stubborn enough to not ever budge. This is alright, but in the end, he gets beat up, but bailed out by whatever plot devices the author wants to throw at him. Maybe, if someone got extremely hurt, someone died for his mistakes, this would have been a key to his character development. Neji's death occurred in the rare moments that Naruto's actions were completely logical and were not made in a hot blooded attempt to stop the enemy. There is no arc where he undergoes the consequences of his actions, nor is there any arc that helps him understand the reality of his dream. What exactly is it that he can do to make hate disappear from the world? This self searching arc never began. I think it would have been immensely helpful to the depth of Naruto if there was just a single arc where he sees how conflict happens and faces the reality that there isn't just a single "good" side and "bad" side. Naruto obviously understands this theme very well, but it was always through the flashbacks of other people that he watches as a bystander, and never as a personal experience, and as a result, he never truly matures as a character as intended. The fourth ninja war could have been a great example of this happening, if not for the fact that that entire arc was pretty dumb. It clearly marks the shinobi world as "the good guys" and Madara and his gang, "the bad guys." Is it really a shinobi war if it's essentially Madara versus the entire world? It's ridiculous how such a great potential arc became a "good" vs "bad" guy arc. If there was a split in nations supporting and going against Madara, this could not only have been a great way to express how conflict isn't always black and white, but also great fights. Instead, we see lame fights between reanimated people, rather than real ones with real motivations. There is such a distinction that the author wants to make that "these guys are bad and mind controlled by jutsu" that it was hard to sit through. In fact, instead of having people side with Madara, in the end, everyone that used to support him goes against him, truly making it so that there is as little need for any distinction between good and bad at all. The entire war arc feels like a "side character" arc and doesn't feel like there was any sort of real engagement or conflict of interests in place, since again, everyone on the enemy side was mind controlled or copies of Zetsu. Sasuke, on the other hand, manages to be a much better character in this aspect. Broiled in revenge, he kills his older brother, only to find out the undertones and plots that are hidden in the village. He sets his eyes on the sole reason why Itachi had to kill his own clan: the clan itself. However hot blooded revenge is stopped short by meeting with his brother once again through edo tensei. This arc of revenge to redemption is a clear turning point in Sasuke's character, and is the reason why his goals go from a revenger to a desire to be a savior. This decision to become a savior was also only after he came face to face with the previous hokage, which again, further reinforce the fact that not everything is light and dark. He also cements his perfect idea of what it is to achieve his goal as a savior. What Naruto and Sasuke both have in common are their idealistic hot blooded pursuits in their goals, yet Sasuke manages to comprehend, through his self reflection, on how to achieve his goals, however silly they might have been. And despite the fact that there is such a focus on Naruto's character the entire series, there fails to be any sort of progression as a character in Naruto for the most part, only reinforcing his idealistic dreams, while Sasuke is able to become a more well rounded character with much less screen time and focus. In the end, Naruto's and Sasuke's goals are both idealisitc, but Sasuke matures more as a character, and even determines his next course of action without much difficulty, while Naruto is merely led along the plot of "defeating the bad guys" for essentially, the entire series. This does make Naruto progress as a character, but stops short of actually trying to make his abstract goals tangible through his own way of thinking. Plot armor is also a pretty big issue for Naruto, but it is such for all shounen series in general, but the more pressing issue is power progression. Naruto is considered to be a pretty untalented person, yet he still manages to become the strongest shinobi in the world. How did that happen? Power progression in Naruto Shippuuden is one of the most inconsistent things. People get crazy powers throughout the entire show, and not only is this method fast and instantaneous, it also happens so often. There are so many times in the show where a huge fight is tilting greatly in one side's favor, but due to a crazy powerup reversal, the other side has a great advantage. Both the "good side" and "bad side" do this constantly near the end of the arcs. Not only is this pretty stupid, it doesn't make a lot of sense plot wise. There were many times where some people were so overpowering the other side that the fight was declared over, yet somehow, they don't finish them off and allow them to power up. This power progression is also reserved for a select few, so essentially Sasuke and Naruto become the only relevant characters, power wise at the end of the story. This brings more consequences other than poor plot. It completely destroys and semblance of need for any side characters, and this is my biggest problem with the series. Naruto has one of the best cast of characters in the entire series. Lee, Tenten, Gaara, Neji, Guy, Iruka, Ino, etc etc. There are definitely quite a cast of arcs dedicated to a lot of side characters in Naruto, and it is one of the best points in Naruto. These characters have great personalities and contributed to the plot greatly, earlier in the story, yet fade to obscurity as the story goes on, and when Sasuke and Naruto become overpowering and leave everyone behind to the point where they don't become any sort of meaningful support. Arcs without Naruto in it tend to be pretty damn good. My favorite arc in Shippuuden was definitely Shikamaru and Asuma's arc. The fights were great, Shikamaru's development was great, and the enemy was interesting to watch. In the end, it goes to show that it was definitely possible for there to be a lot more potential arcs concerning the rest of the cast of characters, but it was never explored, but rather just wasted on Naruto. Fights were flashy for sure, but when the same message of "wow you're just like me, I was lonely and sad too," and "bad guys are bad, I want peace" gets repeated over and over again, you wonder what could have happened if these characters got more love. Not only are characters shoved aside because power level wise, they were completely obsolete, but it also got rid of any sort of interesting fights involving ninjutsu. Shikamaru's arc, again, is an excellent example of this. His shadow binding jutsu was used in unique and different ways, and so were the enemy's jutsu as well. He couldn't afford to get injured because the enemy was able to reflect injuries right back at you. There was a lot of strategy and matchups that were used, but in later fights, this doesn't happen. It's just more like "I'm going to bash you in with my OP power, you don't stand a chance," and for the most part, this is basically what happens. No unique techniques get introduced, no interesting strategies, but just straight up broken and OP powers get brute forced into defeating the enemy. Elemental weaknesses and strengths essentially don't get mentioned ever again at some point. It really sucks. Power creep in Naruto not only demolish characters, but it also got rid of the interesting ninjutsu's that people were employing in fights. This is most apparent in one single ability: Edo tensei. A completely busted and overpowered ability that has so much impact on the ninja war, yet apparently becomes super weak in the later arcs. What happened to invincibility? What happened to unlimited chakra? Edo tensei manages to become one the most busted jutsu's in the show, but becomes practically useless by the end of it, and it also highlights the lack of consistency. Edo tensei not only becomes obsolete because of power creep, but more importantly, it actually gets weaker for no reason at all. It goes from an invincible form that can't be stopped other than sealing. Regardless of element type, sage chakra, or OP abilities, they will regenerate. Regardless of how much chakra is used, they can regenerate. These features become disabled right after the ninja war arc, and it's never explained. What a bunch of bull. I talk about characters in Naruto as if there were no bad ones. Far from the truth. Sakura and Kuruma are the worst characters, by far, in the series. I always knew the meme about Sakura being useless was a thing, but I thought it was an exaggeration , if anything. It really wasn't. Sakura is a piece of emotional baggage that had literally no influence on the plot other than the fact that Naruto liked her. Liked. her. It was pretty clear that Naruto liked Sakura in the beginning of the series, but as time went on, Naruto accepted that Sakura didn't have the eyes for him, and Naruto even matures so great that he calls her out on his fake confession. This shows how much as a character Naruto grew in this department at the very least. If this were in the beginning, Naruto would have accepted it no doubt. Sakura, on the other hand, can't make up her mind. Time and time again, she can't make her own decisions, and it's clear that her only role in the series is to make us pissed at her. She can't make a decision on Sasuke. Or on killing Obito. or on her resolve to fight. She is such a static character, as she never truly progresses or matures throughout the entire series, and is babied the entire way by all the people around her, especially Naruto. She too, suffers from power creep immensely, and never manages to catch up to, even after her line of "I've caught up to them, Tsunade" quote. What a joke. She's unironically also a simp. Loves Sasuke from beginning to the end, despite Sasuke only berating her, trying to kill her, and not making a bond with her to the end. Even after all the crap Sasuke does to her, she is irrevocably in love with him. Holy. Crap. Naruto moves on with his love eventually, yet Sakura manages to never do such a thing. Without reason, no matter what Sasuke does, Sakura loves him anyway. She didn't do a single thing for Sasuke, in the end either. As Sasuke said, the only bond he had was with Naruto, not Sakura. Naruto was his only friend. Naruto is the one that Sasuke acknowledges, not Sakura. Overall, not an impactful character. She hogs a bunch of screentime only because she was on team seven in the past with Naruto and Sasuke. Kuruma's definitely a much better character than Sakura, but he's still a pretty bad one. He just randomly transitions from an amalgamation of evil to "good guy" within the span of a few minutes in a single episode. I think we all knew that Naruto was going to bond with Kuruma and that Kuruma was going to eventually befriend Naruto, but what a lame and anticlimatic bonding that was! Sure, there were many arcs regarding the evil nature and uncooperativeness of Kuruma, and the his tug of war with Naruto, but there really wasn't much of a bonding arc, and this was much needed. In the end, he gets defeated by Naruto, and acknowledges him as a result. You might be thinking that Sasuke's bonding with Naruto was essentially the same thing, but Sasuke wasn't actually "defeated" by Naruto physically, but philosophically. and this gets explained a lot more. Kuruma's arc felt like subdued=good guy. Not only was it short, it didn't make a lot of sense. That concludes the main points I wanted to share. There was a lot more to cover, but these were the major points that I wanted to cover. Side note: I had the benefit of being able to watch both the anime and read the manga long after the series had ended, and as a result, I was able to navigate any and all fillers by combining my reading through any chapters that were mixed/filler, and skipped all the episodes that were filler. As a result, I had the unadulterated canon viewing experience, and in my opinion, the best way to experience the show. I can't say I would have enjoyed the series as much if I didn't have this opportunity, and can't blame other people for disliking the show because they had to sit through all the filler content. But hear me out. I get it, the filler is bad, but unlike one piece's way of introducing filler, in Naruto, pacing is still alright. There's just filler in the form of entire filler arcs and flashbacks. This can easily be skipped. One piece's filler was "unskippable." The show was just at a constant snails pace, which led me to adopt only the manga as a result. Given I could skip the filler, I still rate the anime decently, comparable to the manga.

I am completely overwhelmed with the slow pace of this show. This show is not what it used to be back then. The story is definitely good, the art is decent, sound...sure it's good, characters are definitely interesting, but I just cannot enjoy it because it is so slow. The fights are too long. At first it was fine, but it kept on nagging me. I'm just going to drop it. It was fun watching this anime series, but it just is not developing quickly enough.

To be honest.... this show was actually great... in essence, it could have been one of the most amazing and adventurous shows imaginable, with kick ass fighting scenes and heart felt emotions that are honestly pretty relate able. With its large and expansive world, having its own history to it, it's hard to imagine such a show being fucked up!!!.... Oh wait... -.- Now being serious, Naruto could have honestly been one of the greatest shows imagine able. You have this fleshed out story following this one kid who was looked down upon his entire life, and you see him rise and up and fulfill his dream. What could be bad about that!? That already sounds awesome!! Then you add in some more kick ass characters like Kakashi and fighting scenes and an actual story and a goal and boom!! Sounds good right? R-right....? Now... here's where in my personal taste, this potentially amazing story and show, goes skyrocketing the opposite direction it had the potential to go for. There is, so much, SO, MUCH, POINTLESS, TALKING...... in this show you will catch yourself watching 40% of the last season despite it being the next season and when I say this I mean the FLASHBACKS HOLY SHIT. The fillers in this show are even immense, most of the talking in this show is also very pointless.... and what's worse? The action is crap!! And no, I don't mean the action itself is crap, honestly it was pretty enjoyable, that 1 minute of fighting you saw for every 45 minutes of talking, you get why I think it's crap now? Even IN the middle of some fights when all the action is building up and the drama and intensity is rising, SOMEONE, SOMEWHERE, has to SOMETHING, that involves that..... or wait, even better... a flashback.... This show honestly had so much potential, it has such a wide spread world that is honestly pretty unique and creative. It has a very fleshed out story, explaining things from the VERY beginning (you rarely if ever see shows doing this) and an amazing adventure following this one admirable kid grow up with great and fleshed out characters near him. The fighting itself is honestly not boring and some of the dialogue is honestly pretty interesting, and heartfelt. But what totally and completely ruins this show for me is the fillers, the constant nonsensical talking, and the CONSTANT FLASHBACKS I CANNOT STRESS THIS, We just got done watching Naruto when he was a kid (first season) and we're onto the second season and you think we need to REWATCH what we already WATCHED!? And that's not including the fillers that INVOLVE flashbacks that have NOTHING to do with the show. Literally the most pointless thing imaginable, imagine it, right now, and Naruto will make a fucking filler out of it somehow. Mind you most of this is the show version, I heard a lot of the fillers and pointless talking is taken out of the manga, but honestly I wish they did a better job with the anime.... the sounds in this show are honestly quite nice and do a good job of impacting the show and making the scenes they provide more vibrant..... With Narutos interesting and unique characters and setting, along with an admirable person following an ambitious dream leading us to various interesting and adventurous tales and awesome fight scenes, this show had so much potential..... I hope in the future they will do a rework on this could be great show.

This is so much better than Naruto guys. This is a whole other level than that and it deserves your time. Here's why: Story: 10 This show doesn't have an over arching goal like many anime do (Hunter x Hunter 2011 or One piece for example) but it just a story of a boy growing up and maturing into one of the finest shinobi and coming into contact with the problems of the world he lives in. He meets people and gets help and guidance along the way while becoming more and more reliable and powerful. It really is awesome. Art: 9 I love the art and the theme it gives the show is great. The only reason this isnt a 9 is it can get sloppy at times, especially during fights which really angers me at times but usually it is great. Sound: 9 Though sometimes is can be a bit cheesy I absolutely love the soundtrack of this show as well as the original Naruto soundtrack. Character:10 Some of the strongest parts of the show are seeing the connections Naruto creates with others and seeing his relationship build with the people closest to him. You really really feel his development as a leader, fighter, and thinker in this show and are cheering for him every step of the way. He isn't a spazzy annoying kid anymore and you really see that. Progression of characters is show as the theme of generations is really stressed and the youth inherit the world from the old and children become their parents etc. It is a fantastic theme. Enjoyment: 9 The fights in this show are awesome and the new powers and villains are some of the best parts of this show. My single character villain ever is in this show. Guess who it is I bet it won't be that hard haha. This show makes you run in circles going "DAMNNNNN" and also can make you tear up a bit and make sure no one sees. Overall:9 It isn't a masterpiece, but it is damn close and by no means a waste of time for anyone. Go watch this show. Especially if you have scene Naruto and think their world of jutsu is interesting then this will be a great use of your time. I watched it twice already and it was just as good the second time (skip the fillers though honestly).

Naruto Shippuden is 60% filler episodes and 40% story Story: This is your basic gotta get to the next power level to beat Cell kind of story. they do try to throw in some emotional stuff but it falls very flat and the ending ends just how you expect it. The story is so attached to the main group of side characters the only 3 out of over 20+ actually die. Art: Even though the anime ran from 07' to 17' the art style more or less stayed in the 07' era thus the later animation is average quality Sound: Many Many theme songs for some one or two might be decent enough. However the Main characters voice is like nails on a chalkboard. The same song is used repeatedly(for dramatic effect) in many of the episodes thus nullifying any impact it once had. Characters: The One place where this anime shines and the reason this anime has the most fanfics of any anime. Let me be clear, Naruto the main character has a terrible voice, is pretty annoying and has a extremely ridiculous obsession with Sasuke. I hate Naruto, but There are so many other decently fleshed out characters you will find a few that you may like and most of these character get an episode or two where they are the main focus. Enjoyment: The fact that every episode has a flashback of a previous episode or flash back of a flashback that we have already seen (which sometime take up more then half the episodes runtime) makes this anime extremely annoying to watch and has gained the nickname FlashBack Simulator. Then smack dab in the middle of a main story arc they put in filler arcs just to extend the series length and making so you have to burn through an arc that has nothing to do with the main story to get back to the main story. Even then some episode are nothing but slow talking with long pauses and by the time the episode ends not a lot has actually happened. Some fights are really really good while others they just stand there and talk a lot. Overall: If You have LOTS of spare time and liked the original series you may like this or you could skip to the last 10 or so episodes and be like ok this is them 2-6 years later the end.

Story: The story of Naruto Shippuden is about Naruto Uzumaki he is one of the 9 jinchuriki. Naruto came back to the Leaf Villiage and god knows where he was. And this continues with Naruto continuing going after Sasuke Uchiha, his best friend. It's a nice story to be honest. Art: The art in Naruto Shippuden is the same as the original just a bit upgraded. It's art is very good, compared to most anime I've seen. Sound: The sound is great it's the same as the original Naruto, so there's not that much to it. Character: The character in Naruto is good, it's just the development, it's so slow, and you hardly see any development after any battles. Only with Naruto, you hardly see any other characters develop. Enjoyment: I've enjoyed the series a lot, Naruto is one of my first animes I've ever watched it's a good anime, and it has a great story, very good art, and great sound. Overall: I rate Naruto Shippuden an 8/10. The sequel to this series great, the art and sound are great, same with the story. It's just the character that stops this anime from getting a 9/10. I wish we get to see other characters learn new jutsus, this series is very good overall. I recommend it to people getting into anime.

Even though I marked some things as outstanding... I have to say that I think the writer and anime producers of this anime need to stop focusing so much on developing Sasuke. I'd like to see more of what Naruto can do then see Sasuke completely be the main focus when the anime and manga is called Naruto...I dislike it when writers focus more on one character instead of focusing on the whole reason they wrote the series called NARUTO.
I'm sorry but i didn't like this anime i thought the art was very disappointing i also thought that tv tokyo really let me down with it there a zero for over all sorry if u hate me

Before I begin, I notice this anime is one of those "love or hate" animes. There's some people who say it's the shettiest anime ever, and some who say that it's the best anime ever. The people who claim it's the best anime ever should watch some more anime and THEN re-rate, and the people who claim it's the shettiest anime ever... are just following the crowd because people like to bash on the popular anime. This anime is seriously NOT OVER-rated given how many people hate this anime, and it's also not UNDER-rated given how many people love this anime. Done with my rant xD Story - 7/10 It goes by arcs and the story isn't confusing (if you watched from the beginning) and several arcs are really sad and the plot was interesting to watch. However, I feel like it's dragging on and on, and the comedy scenes aren't as funny as the first Naruto. Another thing is the "I will bring back Sasuke! Believe it!" and "He's a precious friend!" is overused too much. Is Sasuke the only thing Naruto thinks about? (Then comes the SasuNaru fans, myself included) I don't get how a traitor who betrayed his friends and village due to jealousy and vengeance is still a friend, but if Naruto thinks that, then it's fine I guess. Art - 9/10 Clean and easy on the eye, nothing too special, but the art is pretty nice. Sound - 10/10 Character - 7/10 The characters each have their own personalities, and I don't see much Mary/Gary stus.... except for Naruto himself. Not only can he train faster than anyone else (like when getting the rasengan and sage mode), he can also persuade a godly powerful dude (Pein). Naruto, in the beginning was a knucklehead ninja that everyone hates, but toward the end, he became less of a knucklehead and people began to acknowledge him, which was good character developement. Something about the characters annoy me, and that is how SO MANY characters have a emo sob story behind them. Enjoyment - 9/10 I enjoyed it. Overall - 7/10 The "motto" is like "If you work your butt off and have the will to do something, you will succeed" which is obviously not true. I also dislike the fact how Naruto often touches his tummy and go like 'Oh the nine tailed fox is inside me" It just looks wrong... and sounds wrong... I can imagine Naruto giving birth to the Nine tailed fox lol.... Another thing I'd like to say has nothing to do with the review, but if the whole village treated me like shot shet and a jealous friend betrayed me, I wouldn't just put up with it... I'd probably bomb dat stupid village and give the friend a serious beating...

Oh dear, where do I begin? Okay, the first few arcs weren't too bad. We have a few decent storyarcs with a few alright filler arcs in between, that don't actually seem like fillers. Well, they kinda do, but they have their own intriguing stories. In the Wikia, it now splits some of the arcs so those unfamiliar to the listing (e.g. 'Itachi Pursuit' once featured the hunt for Itachi as well as stories revolving around him and Jiraiya's battle) will be confused (like I was just now!). Even the back-story featuring Jiraiya, and the Kakashi Gaiden adaptation was amazing to watch. Like Part 1, Shippuden features updated art, but it is still ugly in areas (have you seen the background ninja - who drew them?). The sound is pretty much the only thing that's going for the anime at the moment. The emotional openings and endings are still something I'm interested in. I know this is entirely to do with Kishimoto, but at least give Ten Ten some non-filler character development! She's worse than Sakura! Ten Ten only has development in the filler. The worst thing about the anime is the fillers. Yes, I said it. The fillers since the War arcs have all flashed back from before the War, and currently do not serve a purpose within the anime. At the end of 2015, there are only eight canon episodes. Where one of the main conclusions of the manga feature, instead there is no end of fillers - and as far as we can tell, none in January either - I'm looking at animefillerlist.com at the moment. Do yourselves a favour and read the manga if you haven't. It's not much better, though. If Naruto had an entire reboot away from Studio Pierrot, the fillers should be rewritten and classified as 'canon', and then the fillers are in their original places (so that they follow along in chronological order as to not confuse fans and keep the dynamic of the War arcs going).

ok...I honestly really like Naruto but i have one thing to say.... WTF IS UP WITH THE TWO MAIN RELATIONSHIPS?! And dont get me started on Naruto and Hinatas relationship shieeet how can he fall in love with her in one movie ONE. How was he blind the whole show but then she makes a scarf and then he can magicly see like..... MAKE IT MAKE SENCE. Saske deadass told Sakura she was annoying many times and keep rejecting Naruto and going after the guy who dont like her -_- I know this is about shippuuden but why did they have to fuck up my niggas hair line like that....Seriously. but thats all thank you :)

A very interesting and very original story, it has many values and teachings, its animation is very good at the moment, much better since its emission, its soundtracks are beautiful and magnificent, of the best that you can get to listen.The characters are very original, although some have more prominence than others as usually happens in all anime, the secondary are not so forgotten.I recommend it, you will like it very much, easily this among the best shonen animes, and personally it is my favorite without doubt, that if you do not like the fill just skip it and end the problem. (But not all fillers are bad, some are a work of art like "Chikara") Very epic.

It's way too old....back when I was in school watching some random Anime, I was told by my friend that a new Anime named Naruto is going to start soon in CN. That's when everything was changed....!! I have seen the first episode, to me it was amazing. It captivated me completely. That Anime had made a great impact on my life. I've learned so many things from that Anime. High in morals, it changed my way of thinking. I'm here to write a review on Naruto Shippuden which is a part of Naruto's world. To all Naruto/Naruto Shippuden Haters who think that Naruto isn't the best anime.....I disagree with you...coz is not only the best it's greatest of all time. And one more thing, Naruto/Naruto Shippuden is not for immatures and those who run out of patience very quickly. I consider it as Masterpiece. I do hate fillers...but I like them as well because even fillers in Naruto/Naruto Shippuden has something to do with the morals and the way of living. We all know that story revolves around a knucklehead Ninja who wants everyone to acknowledge him. With help his friends he was able to finally achieve it. There are so many reasons why I like this Anime....they are: 1. Great Story(High in Morals) 2. Deep Characterization(every character in this Anime teaches some good to us, you will get attached to them) 3. Evolution(yes evolution in everything - in the story, in characters, in fights, in techniques), I like new things...! 4. Emotions, Relationships 5. Side Stories(yes side stories of other characters - they are really cool) 6. Memorable heroes and villains(yes though we have one main protagonist we have several side heroes and villains with their awesome stories) 7. Logic(logic in every Jutsu development, in every fight) I've seen Anime with higher ratings but no logic in their battles, training.(IDK why people like something which doesn't support logic) 8. Explanation - everything is explained in detail. 9. Life Lessons - yeah I have learned so many things from this Anime characters. Almost all characters are my favorite but the special ones are Itachi, Naruto, Nagato(Pain), Shisui, Orochimaru, Madara, All Hokages, I will never forget Akatsuki....they are amazing..!! My most favorite episode is a filler....yes it's a filler, a filler in which writer expressed his views about the real world, real people, what it is to create and what it is to destroy, what is life, what is love, what is power? what we can do with our life and how we can be helpful to others!! So many things were just taught just in a single episode. The name of that episode is Ninja Creed. There are so many things that I wanted to explain here but people will get bored of my review so I'm ending this here. Keep watching Naruto Shippuden coz anime is still going on and the rest of the episodes will amaze us just as the previous ones did. Sayonara!!!

Ok First off I've been watching the Naruto series since {May 2016} at first i was not going to write a review, After reading some reviews i felt obligated to put my 2 cents.. This review will be very biased in, my opinion but i dont care. Story 7 ~ We have two main protagonist (Naruto & Sauske) That are seen through the entire series and we also can also add in saukura as well as the rest of the supporting characters that get little to no screen time. If you watch the anime fully and completely then you can follow suit with the story/ plot there are misinterpretations in the story plot altogether. It infuriates me and ill tell you why most of this anime is made up of fillers, not that i find fillers important but its more so a drag you have people that were dead showing up in flashbacks, the fillers are ok i can at least say that honestly they do develop and cover more so of the time when all the shonobi were young and other crucial points in the plot... I just hate when good parts for example naruto v. pain there was like a ton of fillers i was at the edge of my seat only to be disappointed. Art 5 ~ What happened!!!! the art is terrible why did they get lazy tho???... the art is very flat you have stiff characters i wasn't really paying attention but when i actually did they looked like sticks talking, they got the characters flying in the air???.. moving forward i can say that i do like some of the sunsets that were really pretty and seemed some what realistic and some fights that really looked good and was vibrant overall they could have did better they got lazy and thats just that. Sound 8 ~ Personally i love the sound some of the soundtracks like "closer, diver, and yellow moon that i was able to find on itunes and now i listen to them daily... some of the music is ok but i still listen thoroughly (so i can grab food so i can watch the next episode) lol Character 6 ~ Ok in naruto shippuden theirs really nothing fun and giddy about it i must admit when i watched naruto i found it very annoying and extremely whinny but i continued watching it and it was very rewarding as i continued to go along with the story, naruto is not his same self there is really no humor in the series everyone is serious only sai giving us a laugh with his straight forward responses but there is little to know character development i just seen neji after 8-9 episodes like where are the characters that we all love and adore overall everyone grew up the same only thing i would say thats different is there attire. I wouldnt be surprised if urochimaru can back to life... moving on. Enjoyment 7.5 ~ 8 : ok i wouldnt say that naruto shippuden is trash i did enjoy the breath taking fight scense that had me rewinding every 5 seconds even the waste land of of fillers that seemed annyoing or even the determination that naruto has to save his friend.. they could have just took more time to strategically contrast the art the characters being stiff and character have slits as a mouth... ( naruto passing out after sauske attacked the sumit had me in tears) overall 8 ~ overall this is a good anime but i wouldn't recommend it if your constantly busy with work or school or etc. its very time consuming and if you dont have that much free time then this is not a good anime for you to try and be watching, you can watch a few episodes but the story plot takes so long to build everything started popping off at the chuin exams but dont expect for this show to have fight scenes every episodes overall if you have enough time to sit and watch this anime go for it.

Naruto as a series, is an incredibly complicated masterpiece. Assuming the person reading this has first finished the original Naruto series of our blond haired hero in his trademark Orange tracksuit, I will give a quick summary of some of the critiques I have of this series and what to look forward to in this next amazing sequel. First of all, the soundtrack remains iconic and amazing. The openings remain catchy and the soundtrack is both epic and marvelous. It tends to move away from the very fast-paced Japanese sounding instrumentals of the first series and enters into hymn and choir territory, especially with relevance to characters of God-like status relating to the plotline. Naruto shippuden is a very lore based series, and relates more towards philosophy and morality then the first series ever did. The battles are long, the speeches are longer. I assume Creator Kishimoto wanted his viewers to age up with the anime, beginning to question things they never did as a child. Therefore, expect the anime to become very complex and confusing at some points. Unfortunately, The loveable Konoha side characters that we independently learned and watched fight in the Chuunin exams and Sasuke retrieval Arc have a lesser role in the sequel. New characters and plot lines are introduced and many shinobis are cast to the side lines. The sequel is very much about focusing Sasuke and Naruto's bond and Naruto's own personal character development.. I would argue that the young shinobis still have much relevance, but less screen time in the main storyline as it progresses. The meme of 'NAAAAAAAAAAAAAAARUTOOOOOOO' and 'SASUUUUUUUUUUKEH' is pretty much relevant to the series as Naruto fights further to bring Sasuke back to the village. ^_^ The new characters, especially the Akatsuki characters throughout the story, are super interesting and unique, so look out for them. They are all powerful individual shinobi with incredibly unique designs and jutsus. I found them to be the most enjoyable of the series and I hope the reader does too! Naruto Shippuden may not have the carefree, often comedic, nostalgic attitude of the first series main storyline, but it still provides a much enjoyable series and definitely a fantastic must see sequel to the first series to finally get a sense of closure. I have repeatedly stated the 'main storyline' through out this review, because if you thought the fillers of the first series was bad after the Sasuke retrieval arc...then I have news for you. There is a lot of filler. If you only care about the story and not the alternative universes or random plot lines, you may want to stick to the main story line and skip the filler episodes, however some of the fillers I'd suggest keeping a look out for - especially the alternative universe ones, as they give an interesting opposite perspective to the main canon universe. Just try not to get jealous if the alternative universe seems more...idealic then the real world, blood thirsty shinobi world..that was my trap of watching them! I wanted things to be different! ^_^'' I hope you enjoy Naruto as much as the rest of us do, and watch our snarky, smart-mouthed Kyuubi protagonist manifest and develop into an amazing, strong-willed character with all his comrades behind him as he fights for what he believes to be right and true. Dattebayo!

Story 8/10 - As many have already pointed out, the sheer amount of fillers and flashbacks, boy! They're unbearable. But thanks to fan-made Naruto Kai, pacing should no longer be an issue now. Still, can't afford tens of hours? Watch the entire show at 1.7x speed then! If you're a native Japanese speaker like me, you should have no problem keeping up. Some of the arcs like Pain's arc had a deep & profound philosophical theme and I loved it. Had it not for the pacing, I would've given 10/10, but alas. ________ Art 6/10 - I had to drop the show for 2 years because of the art-style. The change from Naruto to Naruto Shippuden certainly requires a bit of getting used to. Picking it back up after two years, everything looked so much better for some reason. But still, it's by no means perfect or even good. The animation on the other hand was outstanding, especially battle scenes. ________ Sound 10/10 - To be honest I didn't care about the OPs & EDs. But that's just because I'm not into Jpop (atm). They're by no means bad, though. The voice actings were superb. The casts were amazing. LOVED the background music! - 10/10 ________ Character 10/10 - Masashi Kishimoto is a genius at making characters loveable. Gotta love the easy to remember simple character names & their unique quirks. Most characters had a pure heart, and that's what drew me in. - 10/10 ________ Enjoyment 10/10 - As I said, watch the Kai version at 1.7x speed and you'll enjoy every minute of it! ________ Overall 10/10 - I always preferred One Piece over Naruto, I even fought my college friends over it, but after finishing the series today, well what can I say, I've finally experienced the change of heart. Lol. Naruto is now one of my all-time favorites - Take my 10/10!!

QUICK REVIEW, MINOR SPOILERS. so.. I finally watched Naruto, dubbed as one of the three great big shounen, and I have so many mixed feelings about it.. so let's start! Story 7/10: the story... was not one of its strongest points. It's good, but does it drag on unnecessarily with plot Twists that make no sense at times? 100%. A prime example of this is orochimaru switching sides randomly and with no real explanation other than 'the wind'. This is a character who's literally committed genocide. That said, I do think the mangaka does an insanely well done job with highlighting certain themes from beginning to end, such as perseverance and friendship. The repetitiveness of the constant love/hate between sasuke/naruto, the idea of the 3 in a team representing history & idea of hate and love itself throughout history is what truly brought forward emotions for myself and really carried the plot. That said, pain arc was a masterpiece, and all the other arcs in shippuden pale in comparison. Furthermore, it concluded the huge series really nicely with the wedding... makes me wonder if boruto was needed... Art 4/10: disgusting, and the reason is in this section im including the outright bad fillers and flashbacks. Okay some fillers mightve been good , but when you're in the middle of a war and suddenly have a filler of happy konohamaru..no, just no. People use the excuse of 'were binge watching it now but at the time fillers were good' - let me tell you, no they weren't. Why? Because one piece has less fillers than naruto, running since 1997+ and being double the length . There's other ways to go around lengthening/ delaying the show, and having 20 episode arc long fillers in the middle of scene is a no no. And the flashbacks... you get flashbacks from the episode before. I truly wonder how much better naruto would've been without the fillers and unnecessary flashbacks. Sound 9/10: beautiful, the themes that play during a certain group, truly resonates their character. Openings and endings were solid. No complaints at all. Character 10/10: This is what carried the show. This. When you talk to someone about naruto, they don't say I wanna be naruto, the say I wanna be madara, or itachi or daedara. The villains were so well designed and have so much personality it truly is what made naruto into a masterpiece in my opinion. Naruto didn't carry the show, the villains did. The character development was top notch, seeing narutos growth throughout the entire anime was really solid to watch as well, same with sasuke. Even sakura to a certain extent. Also special shootout to kakashi, easily one of the most liked characters in the entire show, tbh all the characters were above average with design. Then there's the most significant characters, naruto and sasuke. The love/hate between them is so beautiful and eloquent, that it draws out a multitude of emotions from the watcher, who's awaiting them to meet. I've never seen such love portrayed as the way naruto did for sasuke in any anime really. Enjoyment 8/10: Naruto is truly unique. It's an anime I can see why so many people admire it. But let's be honest here, if the villains weren't as cool as they are , I don't think it would've been a show to remember.

Okay this is going to be long so please bear with me. Prior to me many have written reviews on this so, you may not find many new points. So I will not write about separately about story, art etc instead I will try to provide my view objectively. Now coming to Naruto Shippuden, I believe it has received so much positivity majorly due to its nostalgia factor. It may not be as bad as I make it to be for some people but let me explain you in detail. First let us discuss the main protagonists of the show: The main problem I had with this is the main trio. We can simply state them in three words ie, dumb,dumber,dumbest. Yes, they are so dumb. Naruto, the protagonist of the series never ever grows up. He is same as he was in Naruto(prequel) except for a few changes. And the people who used to dislike him come to like him for his same dumb antics. Even the characters who had rarely interacted with him believe in him and give *If its Naruto then it can be possible* vibes. They are the same people who hated him before. The dumber part of the show goes to sakura. She is there to make us believe that she is equally strong and determined in the team #7. Her love(only if you can call it that) towards Sasuke is so unreasonable and forced. She is so clingy and is there just to make life of naruto difficult. She, like naruto never stops the "sasuke sasuke" thing which is annoying as hell. Kishimoto tries so hard to make us think she has become better. She has always been useless, only occasionally used to make us believe even she is strong. At other parts of the show ahe is just there to occupy space. Now comes the dumbest part of the show. Yes, you guessed it right. It is none other than Sasuke. He is one of the main characters of the show but is absent for nearly half of the show. He gets ready to follow some stranger for the sake of power and ends up abandoning his comrades. To speak it was due to his jealousy towards naruto that made him to become strong. His motives are so messed up and they fluctuate tad bit too much to sympathize for his losses. Even till the end he is as hopeless as a person can get. I am trying to not spoil much but his sense of thinking is so messed up in the later part of the series. This is not all, our main protagonist is so righteous that he goes on and on about friendship that he ends up putting all of his friends into risk in order to save one selfish, arrogant idiot. He gives so lengthy speeches to the antagonists that it makes me sick. He never stops ranting. He is just too loud and annoying for a protagonist. His attitude isn't any better as he does some pretty nonsensical shit during missions that would definitely make you question his maturity even after these many years. Yes, 2 years later, Naruto became 15 years old, and his personality is still the same. He is still unable to refrain from himself from doing something stupid that would fuck up his whole team. What irritates me are the techniques. For some reason, everything is an upgraded version of his previous techniques; Rasengan to Odama Rasengan to Rasenshuriken. 5 Clones to 100 Clones, then went to 1000 Clones. Flashbacks are normal in many animes. However, Naruto is an exemption. The flashback last so long and most of the scenes are being repeated. Flashbacks in Naruto do not bear much significance in the story and yet I do not see the reason in dragging the flashbacks. The fight scenes in this show are all talk and no battle. The fight scenes bores me to death. Fight scenes are very predictable. All characters spend most of their time just standing an telling lame stories rather than fighting. This is how the fights go- Naruto uses Kagebunshin. The enemy beats all of them, beats Naruto to pulp, then Naruto teaches the enemy about life and friendship and at last Naruto hits the enemy with a rasengan and the fight ends. The backstories every antagonist is almost the same. Almost all were good but a single situation fucked up their lives and they end up on the bad side. This is not to say that there are no good characters. They are there but they take the back seat in the show. It took Naruto heck lot of episodes to just get a single power up. There is nothing wrong with it but in the final few arcs he literally becomes god which makes all his hard work seem pointless. The final arcs: Ah! These are the worst part of the the show. It involves the great shinobi war which is dragged to death. It is very poorly written and the antagonist at the end of the show makes this show a joke. There is no build up for it. Yes it is the kaguya part. The war part almost makes naruto and his precious friend sasuke gods. They become gods to defeat gods and naruto is now even capable of healing. The final arcs make all the established rules and world building look stupid. Logic goes for a toss in most parts. The good parts like a few arcs and characters are highly overshadowed by the terrible pacing, whole lot of filler and dumb main trio. The pacing is so terrible that there are so many pauses and others efforts put in to drag the show which make me feel nothing even after a bunch of episodes, as they cover very little progression. Don't even get me started on fillers. They just dragged the anime to make some 700 episodes which is not very enjoyable. Finally there are good aspects which others mentioned so I chose not to as I feel they are so overshadowed by the fillers, pacing and the terrible main cast. I don't know how many people liked naruto but to me he seems too dumb and immature. So I mainly believe that this show rides on nostalgic factor. It has many notable inspirations taken from famous shonen series like HunterxHunter and Dragon Ball. In the end all I want to say that there are better shonen series like HunterxHunter and it is not worth the time you put into this series. Believe me when I say you won't miss a single part of story even if you watch it in 2x speed. By the way this is my first anime review. Anyway it doesn't really matter as I have rather made this review pretty late I guess. I beg your pardon for any grammatical mistakes. Thank you for your patience. Signing off...

Shippuuden (non filler) Story 9: pretty solid story I'd say but didn't get the end goal. Naruto did not become hakage(training to be one). Great story of friendships and working as a team. Growing together. Art 9: great art during fights, some of the animation is not the best in the background (character wise) never the least animation is great for it's time. Sound 8: few OP stuck with me, none of the ED stuck with me. Dub cast was on point too, I liked that some of the characters had different VA as time went on since they were getting older. Character 8: great character development, almost all characters from Naruto played a big role in Shippuuden. I didn't end up liking Sasuke(I really don't see why people like him). If itachi didn't exist Sasuke would of been the worse character IMO. Enjoyment 9: honestly fights scenes are incredible and the characters you meet you will fall in love with. Total: 8.6

Naruto Shippuuden is a very well known mainstream fan favourite and continuation to Naruto with 185 filler episodes which aren't bad but y'know they're fillers and do what fillers do. The entire show is very entertaining including alot of the fillers giving you alot of time to have a connection to alot of the main characters, the story has alot of depth with what happens and what each character goes through with actual development so It's not just Naruto who develops. The show also wraps up very nicely although being a show with so many episodes you'll never have the perfect ending which is what Boruto is for. If you still haven't watched Naruto and are just looking at reviews for if you want to watch it or not I'd say it's a great mainstream anime to watch even with how many episodes it has which can look daunting but with the story it gives you it's definitely worth it.

One of the most popular animes of all time.. Writing seems to have gotten better than its original series. The episodes where they showcase the past were probably the best episodes in the whole series other than the fights. The story was good but had bad pacing at times especially during the fights, some flaws, and also the sub par stories of some of the episodes because almost half of them were fillers. Character development was good also. The characters were alright, there are very few that are likable or interesting. Some of the openings and endings of this anime are legendary and are definitely in the anime hall of fame. The music was amazing. Animation looked pretty good but quite inconsistent at times. It had a similar vibe to the previous series. Overall it was an enjoyable series, it was well rounded and the only thing that really sticked out was the lore and history of this fictional world. Memorable: No.. Rewatchable: Maybe..

Naruto fans need to calm down. This show needs 80 episodes MAXIMUM. The long awaited ending was completely BAD. If you have time to watch this UNNECESSARY LONG SHOW, skip the fillers and most episodes and you will still feel bored a bit. Every 50-100 episodes you will feel some kind of excitement, and then, LOOK AT THAT, MORE FILLERS. I was completely hyped for this show, myself and from other people, and I expected so much from it, but it is a really poor and long show all in all. Tastes are different, but there is no need to waste time on such an anime (where most episodes aren't even connected to the manga itself).

First off, I just need to put it out there; I have watched over 300+ plus animes and I can gladly hit my chest and boast about the fact that this masterpiece — Naruto/Naruto Shippuden is my favorite anime ever. It would forever hold a special place in my heart. I would be honest, you might be put off by the ridiculous amounts of fillers which are overwhelming sometimes, but believe me, these same fillers help lighten up the dark theme of the series itself. The fillers are by all means evitable. And while some see these fillers as obsolete, I see them as a funny sitcom which does crank me up. Plot wise/story, Naruto isn't perfect, nothing is perfect. It does have some major plot-holes that I believe can be easily overlooked. The story revolves around a young boy named Naruto, he grew up as an orphan, completely neglected by the village all because he has a demonic (Kurama) fox in him. This is the story of an orphan who by all means wanted to he acknowledged, an orphan who wanted to be loved. All Naruto wanted was a family. A family! All Naruto wanted was to be the hokage so as to protect the village and everyone he loved. Without any context to the filler episodes, Naruto as a whole is one of (if not) the best anime out there. It was a good pacing, very gripping plot, some of the best arcs (I found none of the arc boring; some of my favorites from Shippuden are the pain invasion arc, forth great ninja war arc, and the pursuit of itachi arc, just to mention a few.) fleshed out characters, one of the most iconic villains, interesting characters, probably the best fight scenes I've seen in anime, everything, just name it, Naruto has them all. NARUTO IS THE BEST!

NARUTO SHIPPUDEN is the real deal but it also has its negative points. For example: too many filler episodes(almost 50 percent of anime is made by filler and most of the filler episodes ain,t worth watching at all. Its just waste your life time.) The anime is about the ninja world but its just showing too much hand sighs and trainings and it lacks some great fight scenes. just like season one, there are too many filler characters with a nonesence backstory that really means nothing. It could have so many great fights in it but naruto,s goddamn Talk no jutsu killed the mood. So many great & important characters got killed by kishimoto,s hands just to make naruto & sasuke the only reason to watch the anime or read the manga. There are too many useless characters like Rock Lee,Sai or choji. naruto & sasuke are just two ordinary shinobies that could defeat the gods with the power of friendship(NAKAMA POWER) and its really meaningless. Defeating the immortal & highly trained Gods with only NAKAMA POWER? Give me a break. and also, the plot armor is much more than it should be on my opinion: READ THE MANGA Even the Ending ain,t gonna worth it(watch the anime & you,ll get what i mean) in fact, NARUTO is just the most overrated anime in shounen-jump series. Its the one & only ninja anime that you can get. That,s all.

Naruto Shippuden is definitely one of those series where if you truly understand it, it becomes very memorable whereas if you don't then you see it as mediocre. in it's most basic form Naruto: Shippuden is a series where about a boy named Naruto who just wanted to fit in with people, become respected and acknowledged by everyone including his best friend and rival Uchiha Sasuke. Naruto just represents the unacknowledged youth of today who are ignored by society and left all alone in to rot away. now let's get down to my real review of Naruto: Shippuden Naruto's story is fairly decent enough it doesn't have the best writing of a Shonen anime but it's not bad either it's fairly good. many a times it's about how society can fck you up and make you purposeless that you start to hate society itself, but again this theme seems to be repetitive used amongst some of the major antagonists throughout the series, the plot seems fairly predictable but not as predictable as Mid Ball Z lol Shippuden also has some retcons which were never addressed by Masashi Kishimoto I won't point it out here cuz I don't wanna spoil anybody reading this review. but Naruto is definitely one of the best anime when it comes to plot-twists of the show but hpwever these twists can come off with 0 foreshadowing at all but that IMO does little to make the series look bad, Naruto has very deep real life philosophy and emphasis with characters like Itachi, Obito, Sasuke, Pain , Madara, Hashirama , Hagoromo and Naruto himself. these characters more or less have been through very tight circumstances and in each case they developed different ideologies which are very similar at the same time that they follow. these characters with do or die life situations seem to be well written, when it comes to side characters who aren't villains or anti-heroes or dudes who didnt die a long time ago Naruto does fall short for example the females Naruto seriously are some of the most laglustre in popular the only who ones who even contribute a little are Sakura, Tsunade and Konan, and even then Sakura and Konan mostly serve as supportive beta females to their male counterparts while there is also Kaguya Otsutsuki who seems interesting as a character but the way she gets introduced is very unappealing oh I almost forgot to mention that Naruto:Shippuden also has one of if not the worst written female character in anime Hinata Hyuga, a creep with no individuality who makes me sick just by appearing on screen like everytime she appears i feel like fast-forwarding. Naruto still has some good compelling side characters like Might Guy, Kakashi, Shikamaru, Choji and Sai. Naruto definitely has Immaculate art and fight scenes, Naruto's fight scenes are one of the best in anime and it's mostly thanks to chakra for being a incredible power system throughout the series even from the days of the OG Naruto, Naruto fights such as Naruto vs Pain, Kakashi vs Obito, Might Guy vs Madara will always be remembered by Anime fans for generations to come, Baruti had very good comedy too especially with the adult jokes sprinkled in between. when it comes to music Naruto: Shippuden has incredible masterpiece openings like Silhouette and Blue Bird and endings too, their music is so addicting that I think Naruto: Shippuden is the very reason why I stopped my habit of skipping the openings Overall Naruto is a series that I would recommend if you have the time to go through an anime with 100s of episodes
